newsitem.title: USA: American Financial Q4 hurt by writeoffs.
newsitem.headline: American Financial Q4 hurt by writeoffs.

text.p: American Financial Enterprises Inc on Monday said writeoffs and losses incurred by an affiliate contributed to a decline in its fourth-quarter earnings.
The company in a statement said its earnings dropped to $0.07 a share in the final three months of 1996 from $0.70 in the year-earlier period. Its operating earnings were $0.10 a share versus $0.70.
It said an affiliate had also suffered a "significant" reduction in its realized gains on sales of securities in 1996 compared with the same period the previous year.
The company did not name the affiliate, and company officials were not immediately available for comment.
About 83 percent of the company's stock is owned by American Financial Group Inc.
